document_data.name: Temple of Kelemvor
document_data.mainbody: The '''temple of Kelemvor''' was a holy house dedicated to the [[Kelemvor|Lord of the Dead]] that was open in the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|7}} It was run by [[Alby|Father Alby]], who was assisted by the [[cleric]] [[Nerys]].{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|12}}
document_data.Description:
The church was a simple stone building with a number of steeples. Its facade featured the [[holy symbol]] of Kelemvor, a skeletal arm holding balanced scales.{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|10}}

The temple and its staff safeguarded a number of [[relic]]s considered holy to the [[church of Kelemvor]].
document_data.Activities:
The temple staff assisted with the burials for Baldurian citizens, including soldiers and guards of the [[Flaming Fist]].{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|11}}

Father Alby offered ''[[coin of Kelemvor|coins of Kelemvor]]'' as a means of compensation. These tokens bestowed upon the owner a considerate and respectful funerary service for a single deceased individual.{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|13}}
document_data.History:
At some point during the 1480s, three individuals, [[Dron]], [[Utna]] and [[Sangin]], were skulking around the temple, forcing Father Alby and Nerys to keep a steadfast vigil. In order to have a reprieve, Alby hired the [[Heroes of Baldur's Gate]] to investigate the issue.

The following night, Dron and Utna assaulted the church in their [[werewolf]] forms, accompanied by a nearly a dozen [[skeleton]]s.{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|14}} Nerys was abducted during the battle, along with the brave hamster [[Boo]].{{Cite comic/Shadows of the Vampire 1|17}}
